function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate research and production of test toolkits for disease detection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity of social systems making lockdown implementation difficult","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in controlling sporadic outbreaks in well-controlled areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lagging development of vaccines and medicine","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited use of 5g technology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on combination of digital technologies for epidemic prevention","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential misinformation about the role of 5g in covid-19 prevention and control.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on 5g technology may lead to neglect of other important preventive measures.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to 5g technology may exacerbate existing health disparities.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to prolonged stay-at-home orders and quarantine measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects and mental health impacts of prolonged lockdown measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact on non-communicable diseases ncds due to decreased physical activity during lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the impact of built environment on mental health","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited evidence and diverse research findings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in healthcare and working facilities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large sample survey during covid-19 lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Anonymity and confidentiality in survey","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mental health impact assessment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The assessment contains questions about anxiety symptoms and severity, insomnia severity, and impulsivity levels, which may indicate mental health risks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of poor indoor quality including natural lighting, acoustic comfort, thermo-hygrometric comfort, and privacy during phone calls","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of high depressive symptoms among students","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Association between architectural parameters and depressive symptoms","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to a large number of students in a shared environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor housing conditions contributing to moderate-severe and severe depressive symptoms in students","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects of quarantine during infectious disease outbreaks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential impact of built environment on physical and mental health of individuals and community","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor housing quality and inadequate indoor facilities are related to depressive symptoms.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of natural lighting, acoustic comfort, and privacy in living quarters is associated with severe depressive symptoms.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor-quality views from the apartment are linked to moderate-severe and severe depressive symptoms.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social isolation and poor housing quality impact working performance and productivity during lockdown, potentially exacerbating mental health issues.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clear work-leisure boundaries and productivity-enhancing environment in small apartments may lead to decreased productivity and work-life imbalance.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor housing physical conditions may impact physical health and contribute to health inequalities during long-term stay-at-home periods.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliability bias in self-reporting questionnaires due to under-reporting, under-estimating, and misunderstanding of mental health issues","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of cross-sectional study design in determining temporal relationships between variables","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited generalizability of results due to low response rate and recruitment from a single university","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of larger and more livable living spaces facing green areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interdisciplinary approach and investigation needed","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Centrality of welfare and housing policies in population well-being","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of research on using buildings to prevent epidemics and viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate management of individual behaviors to comply with safety requirements","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited innovation in the built environment to mitigate epidemic spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changing building materials may not effectively trap the virus and stop the spread of covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of specific knowledge about the effects of covid-19 on building configurations and designs","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in creating sustainable and energy-efficient building designs that minimize the negative impact on communities and the environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Infection propagation due to inadequate architectural design","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of inadequate infection control in healthcare facilities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adaptability in healthcare facility design","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor hospital architecture facilitating disease spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of integration of infection prevention in sustainable designs","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation to emerging problems and urgent demands","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
